titleStmt.title: The codex contains the four Gospels, Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. The codex begins with, a) ff. 3r-5r Prefatory matter to the Gospels, and b) f. 5v An Introduction Concerning the Concordance of the Four Gospels, f. 5v The Epistle of Eusebius to Carpianus, f. 6r a paragraph about the four evangelists, especially Matthew, f. 6r titles of the chapters in Matthew, and f. 6v-8v Eusebian canons. Folios 1r-2v are blank.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
The codex contains the four Gospels, Matthew
See in FIHRIST.
, Mark
, Luke
, and John
. The codex begins with, a) ff. 3r-5r Prefatory matter to the Gospels, and b) f. 5v An Introduction Concerning the Concordance of the Four Gospels, f. 5v The Epistle of Eusebius to Carpianus, f. 6r a paragraph about the four evangelists, especially Matthew, f. 6r titles of the chapters in Matthew, and f. 6v-8v Eusebian canons. Folios 1r-2v are blank.

msItem.incipit: 3r-5r: (i) ግብር (ii) ወካልዑ፡በቍዓት፡ (iii) ካልእ (sic for ሣልስ)፡ሥርዓት፡ (iv) ወራብዕ፡ትእምር ት፡ (v) ወኃምስ፡እምአይቴ፡መሠረት፡ (vi) ወሳድስ፡ምስማክ፡ (vii) መሳብእ፡ አርእስተ፡ነገር፡

msItem.title: Eusebian Canons
msItem.note: Rubricated headings and borders of Eusebian Canons.

msItem.title: Matthew
msItem.note: F. 55v: a note on Mark and the titles of the chapters in Mark. Folio 56v is blank.

msItem.title: Mark
msItem.colophon: Ff. 82v-83r: a colophon concerning the place and time of the composition of Mark's Gospel; a note on Luke, and the titles of the chapters in Luke.

msItem.title: Luke
msItem.note: F. 123r: a note on John and the titles of the chapters in John.

msItem.title: John
msItem.note: F. 151v: a note on the number of words in the Gospels.

layoutDesc.layout: 44 lines per folio from ff. 3r-6r; 22 lines per folio from ff. 9r-72v; 23 lines per folio from 73r-99v; 24 or 25 lines per folio from 100r-151r.

seg.p: Ff. 3-8 in a small clear hand; ff. 9-151 in a very good large hand. Headings, ማርያም, borders of Eusebian canons, in red.
